sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The boke of Codrus and Mynalcas Eclogue. 4 Barclay, Alexander, 1475?-1552. Baptista, Mantuanus, 1448-1516. Bucolica. 5.
[44] p. : ill. (woodcuts), port.
Emprinted by Richarde Pynson, pri[n]ter to the kynges noble grace, [[London] : [1521?]]
In verse. Designated Barclay's fourth eclogue in the headings and colophon. Based on: Baptista Mantuanus. Bucolica. 5. Caption title. Printer's name from colophon; publication date conjectured by STC. Signatures: a⁶ b⁴ c-d⁶. The last leaf bears a printer's mark. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

Emprinted by Richarde Pynson, pri[n]ter to the kynges noble grace, [[London] : [1521?]]
In verse. Designated Barclay's fourth eclogue in the headings and colophon. Based on: Baptista Mantuanus. Bucolica. 5. Caption title. Printer's name from colophon; publication date conjectured by STC. Signatures: a⁶ b⁴ c-d⁶. The last leaf bears a printer's mark. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
